_note: This file preserves early thinking about how competency levels might relate to AI tool access. It is NOT used by any code and should NOT be treated as a specification. The mappings below are hypotheses based on one researcher's intuitions, not validated requirements.
description: Speculative mapping between research competencies and AI-assisted research tool features. Preserved for future exploration — not currently enforced or implemented anywhere.

pattern_recognition.name: Pattern Recognition & Data Sense
pattern_recognition.hypothesis: Researchers need pattern recognition judgment to evaluate whether AI-surfaced patterns are genuine or noise

theoretical_positioning.name: Theoretical Positioning
theoretical_positioning.hypothesis: AI can surface related theories but judgment about what constitutes a real contribution requires deep field knowledge

qual_mechanism_extraction.name: Qualitative Mechanism Extraction
qual_mechanism_extraction.hypothesis: Unsupervised AI coding of qualitative data risks shallow pattern-matching without interpretive depth

theoretical_framing.name: Theoretical Framing
theoretical_framing.hypothesis: AI generates many plausible framings; choosing among them wisely requires theoretical sophistication

epistemological_genre.name: Epistemological Genre
epistemological_genre.hypothesis: AI defaults to hypothesis-testing register; recognizing and correcting genre mismatches requires epistemological awareness

adversarial_evidence.name: Adversarial Evidence Handling
adversarial_evidence.hypothesis: AI tends toward confirmation; adversarial instincts and willingness to kill findings are human skills

claim_verification.name: Claim Verification & Integrity
claim_verification.hypothesis: AI can systematize verification but the discipline to catch its confabulations requires trained skepticism

argument_construction.name: Argument Construction
argument_construction.hypothesis: AI produces structurally flat prose; recognizing and enforcing good argument architecture requires explicit mechanical knowledge

open_questions: Should any of these links be formalized as access gates, soft guidance, or documentation only?
Is the relationship unidirectional (skills → tool use) or bidirectional (tool use develops skills)?
How would different research traditions map differently?
Is progressive disclosure (scaffolded modes) better than access gating?
What evidence would we need to validate or invalidate these hypotheses?
